item.title: Beogram 4000: A Fun Evening with a Prematurely Activating Solenoid
item.description: The Beogram 4000 restoration is progressing well. Rebuilding the deck led to a successful initial power-up where the carriage moved to the correct position, but the arm wouldn’t lower. A visual inspection showed a disconnected thin grey wire from the SK3054 NPN power transistor (0TR4). Tracing the wiring and consulting the schematic revealed that the grey wire connected to the transistor’s emitter, responsible for bypassing a current-limiting resistor (7R1) during the arm’s initial descent.

item.title: Beogram 4000: A New Arrival From Germany - A First Peek
item.description: A Beogram 4000 turntable arrived from Germany for restoration, packaged securely with double boxes and separate protection for the platter. The inner box housed the Beogram within a styrofoam liner, while the two accompanying cartridges, an MMC20 E and an MMC20 EN, were packaged together. Unfortunately, the cartridges shifted during transit, causing the cantilever of the EN to press against the E cartridge’s plastic shroud. Thankfully, upon careful inspection, it appears that both cantilevers remain undamaged.

item.title: Beogram 4000 (type 5215): replacing sensor arm photo cell with modern one
item.description: I recently had two Beogram turntables (a BG4000 and a BG4002) in my workshop with malfunctioning photocells in the detector arm. Usually, these photocells have a long lifespan, but the light bulbs can experience broken wires. While a pre-existing LED replacement for these bulbs exists (see sensor arm light bulb replacement), in this instance, the photocells themselves had broken wires and even a fractured cell, rendering repair impossible. Finding replacements proved futile as well.

item.title: Another Surprise Addition To The Workshop Beogram 4004
item.description: In 2021, I refurbished my Beogram 4004 turntable, which I call the “Workshop Beogram 4004”. Later that year, I added the Beolover Remote Commander and have enjoyed using it to play records. This year, I made another enhancement to my Beogram 4004: a Beolover SyncDrive Platter Motor. I was eager to try it out after reading about it on the Beolover Blog. My Beogram 4004 was already restored and in regular use, with a perfectly functional DC platter motor restored by Beolover in 2021.

item.title: Beogram 4000: A New Arrival from the UK
item.description: A Beogram 4000 turntable recently arrived from a UK seller for restoration. This report outlines its pre-restoration condition. Upon arrival, the unit was quite dirty but in good overall shape. The dust cover showed typical scratches from storage, many deep enough to feel with a fingernail. However, it can be polished back to good condition. Positively, the dust cover features an aluminum strip instead of the less durable plastic type, and the hinges appear to be intact.
